main event: Weather Station personnel at Point Barrow, Alaska, observed a light in the sky while tracking a balloon, which moved from East to West for approximately six hours.
interesting points: The light was observed at a speed of 3-4 degrees per minute., The object was plotted as the planet Jupiter by AMC., Dr. Sibley, an astronomer, opined the light was a planet, likely Venus., The observation took place on 27 July 1949., The altitude of the observed light was between 50,000 and 60,000 feet.
